node.title: Childcare 'crisis situation' as vaccine mandates force some workers out
node.alt: A small child stacks blocks high into a tower.
node.description: Childcare centre operators say fee hikes at some centres are inevitable as mandates for COVID-19 vaccinations around the country force them to terminate some staff and put others on leave.
node.content:
["Childcare centre operators say fee hikes at some centres are inevitable as mandates for COVID-19 vaccinations around the country force them to terminate staff and put others on leave.\u00a0\u00a0", "With the deadline for mandatory jabs for workers approaching in many states, peak group Community Early Learning Australia says a survey of operators in states with mandates show small stand-alone and community-run centres have been hardest hit.", "Chief executive Michele Carnegie said the organisation's survey of more than 100 centres in NSW showed two-thirds had experienced staffing problems because of the mandate.", "When the NSW cut-off for vaccinations happened on November 8, 200 staff were unable to attend work because of their vaccination status.", "Among those vaccine-hesitant staff, 36 per cent have since quit, 38 per cent have been put on leave, 6 per cent were terminated, and 16 per cent found off-site roles.", "\"There's definitely been a drop in staff,\" Ms Carnegie said.", "\"For many services, it hasn't impacted them, but it's the really small ones where there's been an issue.\"", "All states and territories except Queensland and Tasmania\u00a0have introduced vaccine mandates\u00a0for childcare workers, along with major provider Good Start Early Learning.", "", "
Michele Carnegie said the childcare sector was in \"crisis\" because of workers leaving over mandates.(ABC News: Niall Lenihan)
", "Ms Carnegie said affected services had been forced to reduce places or hours of operation.", "One in five childcare centres had to combine rooms or groups of children, and 22 per cent had to reduce the ratio of staff to children.", "\"It's put us in essentially a crisis situation,\" Ms Carnegie said.", "\"It's devastating to lose people out of the sector but we must keep our children safe.\"", "Some centres dealt with the shortages by offering staff more money, but Ms Carnegie warned that would not benefit everyone.", "\"It will flow to parents in the form of higher fees,\" she said.", "
Government help needed for workforce crisis
", "The crisis has prompted calls for extra government help for a sector already struggling during the pandemic.", "Ms Carnegie said even a 5 per cent drop in staff could leave centres short-staffed because the federal government had legislated staff-to-child ratios in all centres.", "\"This means the number of places available for early education and care will reduce, and higher demand for qualified staff is also likely to drive up staffing costs,\" she said.", "The sector is calling for any assistance to address the dire workforce shortage.", "\"We need the government to give consideration to retention payments so we can keep the staff who are already in the services, potentially relocation payments,\" Ms Carnegie said.", "\"This is not a short-term problem, it is a long-term problem.\"", "", "
Graziela Ciunciusky said the majority of her staff had been vaccinated before the mandate kicked in.(ABC News: Tom Hancock)
", "Graziela Ciunciusky manages the World of Learning Centre in Kingsgrove, Sydney, a suburb that was within some of the local government areas of concern in the Delta outbreak.", "At the peak of the outbreak, enrolments fell from roughly 35 children a day to about 10.", "Ms Ciunciusky said it was already difficult to attract new staff, and mandates would likely make it worse.", "\"It's been very hard to find some educators. If someone wants a job, please let me know,\" she said.", "Ms Ciunciusky said the majority of her staff had been vaccinated by the time NSW mandated the vaccine for workers in August.", "\"Being with the children, living with so many families and if you get sick, everybody's going to get sick,\" she said.", "However, the mandate did lead to one staff member who had not yet got around to getting a jab to book an appointment.", "\"The good thing is, as soon they made it mandatory, it was so much easier for them to book the vaccination.\"", "
Parents conflicted about mandates
", "Canberra mother-of-two Courtney Swain said the question of vaccine mandates was a dilemma for parents.", "She and husband Jason kept their children Harlon, aged three, and Spencer, aged four, home from preschool and child care during the lockdown in the ACT.", "", "
Courtney Swain said as parents, she and her husband felt conflicted about mandatory vaccines for childcare workers.(ABC News: David Sciasi)
", "\"On one hand, I'd love to see that carers are vaccinated because our kids aren't able to have the vaccination,\" she said.", "\"But at the same time, workers have individual circumstances as well.\"", "For unions too, it also presented a quandary \u2014 whether to represent those workers who chose not to get a jab.", "The United Workers Union, which represents some childcare sector workers, said it was \"unashamedly pro-vaccination\".", "Helen Gibbons, the early education executive director, said the union supported the NSW government's decision to force childcare workers to be vaccinated.", "\"The early educators I speak to are desperate to get their vaccinations,\" she said.", "", "
Helen Gibbons said while the union supported vaccine mandates, the logistics of getting them could be difficult.(ABC News: Niall Lenihan)
", "However, she said the union did have concerns with the lack of consultation and hurried nature of the NSW mandate, and said other states could learn from their experience.", "\"The vaccination arrangements have been messy and it's been difficult for educators to get their head around and get the logistics right,\" she said.", "\"We see the rules change depending on what local government area you live in.\"", "
Crisis an opportunity for reform
", "The Centre for Policy Development is calling on the government to use the childcare crisis as an opportunity for major reforms to the sector.", "It's calling for governments to commit to a universal entitlement of 30 hours a week, or three days a week, of free or low-cost early learning for all children.", "It would begin with 30 hours of child care and progress to 30 hours of preschool for the first two years before formal schooling.", "The centre's chief executive, Travers McLeod, said that would require a massive injection of staff to prop up a sector already struggling with workforce levels.", "\"We knew before the pandemic there was a projection for the need for 40,000 new workers by 2023,\" he said.", "\"We have to make early childhood education and care one of the most rewarding, secure career options coming out of the pandemic.\"", "Federal Education Minister Alan Tudge declined to comment.", "A Queensland Health spokesperson said mandatory vaccinations were only introduced when it was considered necessary to protect the vulnerable, including people at risk of developing serious illness and those who were unable to be vaccinated.", "A Tasmanian government spokesperson said its mandatory vaccination Public Health Direction only applied to aged care, disability services, and health care.", "\"Other sectors and workplaces are a matter for employers in discussion with their employees,\" she said.", "", "
